dialogueTree.title: Shelf of Romance Stories: "The shelves are littered with roman..."
dialogueTree.text: The shelves are littered with romantic tales from across time and space.

links.title: You: "Look through the display of books."
links.text: Look through the display of books.

links.title: Shelf of Romance Stories: "You see a foamy mass of pinks and r..."
links.text: You see a foamy mass of pinks and reds... colourful covers filled with risqu√© imagery. These books are most oft adorned by women in skimpy clothes, thighs revealed... a few roses and sometimes even some pistols.

links.title: Shelf of Romance Stories: "They also tend to feature chisel-ja..."
links.text: They also tend to feature chisel-jawed men in dark suits. It's all such... glitzy garbage.

links.title: You: "I think I'd enjoy reading a few of..."
links.text: I think I'd enjoy reading a few of these.

links.title: Shelf of Romance Stories: "No, you wouldn't. Being a rough, *h..."
links.text: No, you wouldn't. Being a rough, *hard-boiled* detective, you hope for something more real... more *authentic*.

links.title: You: "Is there anything here that calls o..."
links.text: Is there anything here that calls out to me?

links.title: Shelf of Romance Stories: "Being a rough, *hard-boiled* detect..."
links.text: Being a rough, *hard-boiled* detective, you can only be pleased by something more real, more *authentic*.

links.title: You: ""Storekeep, what's on this shelf?""
links.text: "Storekeep, what's on this shelf?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Oh, such wonderful, beautiful stor..."
links.text: "Oh, such wonderful, beautiful stories. Stories of love!" She sighs wistfully. "You should definitely buy these."

links.title: You: ""To be honest, I'm looking for some..."
links.text: "To be honest, I'm looking for something more *real*."

links.title: Plaisance: ""No-no, sir, you don't want that. T..."
links.text: "No-no, sir, you don't want that. That's not proper romance... romance is about overcoming adversity and finding that *single millionaire* who wants to take care of you until the end of days."

links.title: You: "Does anything more real, more *you*..."
links.text: Does anything more real, more *you* stand out?

links.title: Pain Threshold: "As you focus on the overwhelming ma..."
links.text: As you focus on the overwhelming mass of colourful novels, a discrepancy catches your eye -- one of the books is not like the others.

links.title: Shelf of Romance Stories: "A grey book has lost itself between..."
links.text: A grey book has lost itself between all the romance. The title reads: 'Sixteen Days of Coldest April.'

links.title: Volition: "Turn away, this is a bad idea."
links.text: Turn away, this is a bad idea.

links.title: You: "Why is it out of place?"
links.text: Why is it out of place?

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Someone thought this was a romance..."
links.text: Someone thought this was a romance story, but it's actually a thoroughly excruciating work of psychological realism.

links.title: You: "What's this all about?"
links.text: What's this all about?

links.title: Shelf of Romance Stories: "You'd have to buy the book to be su..."
links.text: You'd have to buy the book to be sure. But the book cover is a wall of concrete buildings, with a black-and-white rainbow covering them. It's written by someone from a country where even the rainbows are black-and-white. So it does seem like it'll be a downer.

links.title: You: "Help, I don't want to do this..."
links.text: Help, I don't want to do this...

links.title: Pain Threshold: "You focus on the overwhelming mass..."
links.text: You focus on the overwhelming mass of colourful novels to find anything of note, but it only ends up with your eyes aching from the strain.

links.title: You: ""I want buy the 'Sixteen Days of Co..."
links.text: "I want buy the 'Sixteen Days of Coldest April' book."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Huh, it's in the wrong shelf... An..."
links.text: "Huh, it's in the wrong shelf... Annette's been moving things around again, has she! That girl..." She shakes her head. "No matter, I hope you enjoy... this."

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]
